content: A 30-35 hour work week is preferable. A plus is to split up work with frequent breaks. I have an interesting proposal: '6-7 hours of work each day spread out in a 10 hour time period'. A worker with ADHD especially should have the option to leave in the middle of a task and come back later. I think this would avoid burnout and boredom much more effectively. Instead of spending 2 hours enjoying work. Getting bored would cause the rest of the 5 hour work period to be unproductive. People with ADHD have a distorted sense of time, so the bored 5 hours feels like much longer than it actually is.

I have social anxiety. I struggle to work effectively in rooms with people physically around. Working remotely or a hybrid work environment is very important to me. This is *not* to say I don't want to interact. On the contrary, I love working with one or two people at a time on a task. Presenting work is a must to stay motivated.
I want to make an impact with my work. I'm passionate about equality and raising the standard of living for those in need.
I crave a challenge in my work. Difficult problems are my specialty.
